item.title: Tyler add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Reading maketh a full man; and writing an axact man. And, therefore, if a man write little, he need have a present wit; and if he read little, he need have much cunning to seem to know which he doth not." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Edward P. Morgan
item.description: "A book is the only place in which you can examine a fragile thought without breaking it, or explore an explosive idea without fear it will go off in your face. It is one of the few havens remaining where a man's mind can get both provocation and privacy." -- Edward P. Morgan

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something." -- Plato

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Rosa Luxemburg
item.description:
"Freiheit ist immer die Freiheit des Andersdenkenden
Freedom is always, and exclusively, freedom for the one who thinks differently." -- Rosa Luxemburg

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Leon Trotsky
item.description: "The end may justify the means as long as there is something that justifies the end." -- Leon Trotsky

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There are a thousand hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
Tyler add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that, you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching, you will reduce the danger by half." -- Winston S. Churchill
